tool.name: Multiple test correction (Beta)

param.name: input
param.label: Wide Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Unique Feature ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique Feature IDs.

param.name: pval
param.label: p-value column
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has your pvalue.

param.name: alpha
param.label: alpha value
param.help: Value of alpha to be used on the corrections by default alpha=0.5.

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
**What it does**
This tool adjust p-values for multiple testing with 3 different methods: Bonferroni,Benjamin-Hochberg and Benjamin-Yekutieli.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input Files**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**In addition to your dataset, you need to provide:**
**Unique Feature ID**
- The column name in your wide dataset that contains the unique IDs for your features. In our example dataset you would input *Compound*.
**Name for p-value column**
- Name of the column containing the p-value column on your wide dataset.
**alpha**
- Value of alpha to perform the test..
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output Files**
- A TSV containing the orignal and adjusted p-values.
